remarks: The sum of a converging infinite series is a complex number. (Contributed by NM, 13-Dec-2005.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Apr-2014.)
statement:
isumcl.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
isumcl.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
isumcl.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = A ) $.
isumcl.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> A e. CC ) $.
isumcl.5 $e |- ( ph -> seq M ( + , F ) e. dom ~~> ) $.
isumcl $p |- ( ph -> sum_ k e. Z A e. CC ) $.
$d F k $.
$d M k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
